alert.note: Alert for Guadalupe County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 6:34PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL...WEST CENTRAL QUAY AND NORTHEASTERN GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM MDT... At 633 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Montoya, or 20 miles west of Tucumcari, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Tucumcari and Montoya. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 307 and 331. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 78 and 96. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
